sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"滑动"之意。
means: slip ： 指不自觉地、偶然地滑动。
glide ： 指自由、顺畅地流动，也指不费力、无声响地滑动。
slide ： 通常多指与光滑表面保持接触并且迅速地连续滑动。
skid ： 着重指不自主地或失去控制地滑动，特指车轮在结冰或潮湿路面上的滑动，常暗含有危险存在的意味。

word_mean: 设备和管系组装在公共底盘上，整体运输和吊装的集装块。

sentence.Network_en: I slammed the brakes on and went into a skid.
sentence.Network_cn: 我猛地一踩刹车，结果车子打滑了。

sentence.Network_en: He became a skid row type of drunkard.
sentence.Network_cn: 他变成了那种贫民区里常见的醉鬼。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a person or their career) in a bad state; failing
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（人，职业）陷入困境；失败的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (as a noun in the sense 'supporting beam'): perhaps related to Old Norse skíth (see ski)

entry.def: If a vehicle skids, it slides sideways or forwards while moving, for example when you are trying to stop it suddenly on a wet road.

example.ex: The car pulled up too fast and skidded on the dusty shoulder of the road...
example.tran: 由于刹车太急，车子侧滑到了满是尘土的路肩上。

example.ex: The plane skidded off the runway while taking off in a snow storm.
example.tran: 飞机在暴风雪中起飞的时候滑出了跑道。

entry.tran: 无法挽救的;注定要失败的
entry.def: If you say that something is on the skids, you believe that it is out of control and certain to fail.

example.ex: His career is on the skids.

means.word_mean: 1. one of a pair of planks used to make a track for rolling or sliding objects
2. a restraint provided when the brake linings are moved hydraulically against the brake drum to retard the wheel's rotation

sentences.sentence: "the car skidded in the curve on the wet road"

means.word_mean: 3. apply a brake or skid to
4. move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner;

auth_sentence.content: Some of my dismissals tend to be from balls that skid on.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some of my dismissals tend to be from balls that skid on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some of my dismissals tend to be from balls that skid on.

auth_sentence.content: My partner pulls a basketball sidestep; I skid to a stop.
auth_sentence.res_content: My partner pulls a basketball sidestep; I skid to a stop.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My partner pulls a basketball sidestep; I skid to a stop.

auth_sentence.content: On grass the ball will bounce lower and skid through the court.
auth_sentence.res_content: On grass the ball will bounce lower and skid through the court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On grass the ball will bounce lower and skid through the court.

means.word_mean: 侧滑；打滑；突然向一侧滑行

sentences.en: The lorry went into a skid and crashed into the barrier.
sentences.cn: 卡车失控打滑撞到障碍物上。

sentences.en: The car has many safety features, including anti-skid braking.
sentences.cn: 这车配有许多特别安全装置，包括防滑制动器。

sentences.en: The police examined the skid marks to see how fast the car had been travelling.
sentences.cn: 警察检查了车轮滑行痕迹，以判断汽车当时开得有多快。

means.word_mean: (通常指车辆)   侧滑；打滑；滑行

sentences.en: He braked suddenly, causing the front wheels to skid.
sentences.cn: 他突然剎车，使得前轮打了滑。

sentences.en: When he went bankrupt he lost everything, and ended up living on skid row for a few years.
sentences.cn: 破产后他一无所有，最后沦落到在贫民区住了几年。
